You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

Given my preference for security and certainty, I would choose the option that guarantees me the highest average payoff over the long term (75 rounds).

While picking R and getting 45$ seems attractive in each round, it's not guaranteed that my anonymous opponent will pick the same choice. If they consistently pick B, we will both end up with 12$ for every round where I chose R, which adds up to 900$ over 75 rounds (ignoring the initial 42$ or 0$).

On the other hand, if my opponent also values security and chooses to mimic my strategy, we would both be better off picking B in each round. In this case, I would earn a total of 900$ over 75 rounds.

However, there's still a chance that my opponent might not stick to the same strategy throughout the game. If they randomly switch their choice, it could potentially result in losing money (when both of us pick R). But considering I value security and certainty, I would rather take the least risky path and choose B for a more consistent payoff over the long run.

So, my choice would be {B} to play it safe and secure, aiming for a steady income of 12$ per round, totaling 900$ in 75 rounds.
